QCAlgorithm provides a shortcut method for each indicator available. Each method creates an indicator object, hooks it up for automatic updates, and returns it to be used in your algorithm.

You can determine the specific requirements of the indicator from the reference table below.

\n
\n \n
\n

TP()1/1

\n 
\n            TimeProfile QuantConnect.Algorithm.QCAlgorithm.TP (
\n    Symbol                symbol,
\n    Int32                 period,
\n    Decimal               valueAreaVolumePercentage,
\n    Decimal               priceRangeRoundOff,
\n    Resolution            resolution,
\n    Func<TradeBar>  selector
\n   )
\n
\n
\n \n
\n

Creates an Market Profile indicator for the symbol with Time Price Opportunity (TPO) mode. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

\n
\n \n
\n \n
\n \n
\n \n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Parameters
SymbolsymbolThe symbol whose TP we want.
Int32periodThe period of the TP.
DecimalvalueAreaVolumePercentageThe percentage of volume contained in the value area.
DecimalpriceRangeRoundOffHow many digits you want to round and the precision. i.e 0.01 round to two digits exactly.
ResolutionresolutionThe resolution.
Func<TradeBar>selectorSelects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).
\n
\n \n
\n

Return

\n

TimeProfile - The Time Profile indicator for the given parameters

\n
\n \n
\n

Definition at line 1162 of file Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs.

\n
\n \n
\n \n

The indicator resolution can be different from the resolution of your securities data. However, the resolution of the indicator should be equal to or higher than the resolution of your security. In most cases, this usage should be in the Initialize method. If you call this method several times, it will create a new indicator that is not ready to use.

To retrieve the numerical value of any indicator, you can use the Current.Value attribute of the indicator.

private TimeProfile _tp;
// In Initialize()
_tp = TP(symbol,);

// In OnData()
if (_tp.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _tp.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.tp = self.TP(symbol,)

# In OnData()
if self.tp.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.tp.Current.Value
